title: Use a preliminary strategy
text: As there is a greatest common factor(5), factor it out. The expression should look like this: $$5\left(k^2-3k-10\right)$$.
speech: As there is a greatest common factor(5), factor it out. The expression should look like this:  5 times parentheses, k squared minus 3 k minus 10  .
pacedSpeech: As there is a greatest common factor(5), factor it out. The expression should look like this:   5 times , k squared minus 3 k minus 10

title: Identify
text: Inside the parentheses, is it a binomial, trinomial, or are there more than three terms? Since it is a trinomial with a coefficient of $$1$$, undo FOIL.
speech: Inside the parentheses, is it a binomial, trinomial, or are there more than three terms? Since it is a trinomial with a coefficient of  1 , undo FOIL.
pacedSpeech: Inside the parentheses, is it a binomial, trinomial, or are there more than three terms? Since it is a trinomial with a coefficient of   1

title: Use factors
text: Use the factors of $$-10$$ to finish FOIL.
speech: Use the factors of  minus 10  to finish FOIL.

title: Answer
speech: The answer is  5 times, parentheses k plus 2,  times, parentheses k minus 5,  .
pacedSpeech: The answer is   5 times,  k plus 2,  times,  k minus 5,
